intro: Pulsatilla armena, commonly known as Armenian pasqueflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine soils and thrives in well-drained environments. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the plant is known for its early spring bloom. Pulsatilla armena is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold climates.
